result.execSummary:
The defendant Desmound D Cleveland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence Credit for 36 days granted.
Court deems TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desmound D Cleveland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Desmond D Cleveland in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend the spelling of the defendant's first name to "Desmound" and will file an Amended Complaint by 4/20/15 by noon.  Court passes matter to comply with victim/witness notification.  Case recalled at 10:22.  Victim/witness notification has been complied with.  Defense would like to proceed with a change of plea at this time.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 3 dismissed and read in.  Case 15CM619 dismissed and read in to this matter and to 15CM260.

Court orders the following:
- 36 days jail.  Credit for 36 days.  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.

Defendant Desmond D Cleveland in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is not prepared to enter a change of plea at this time and requests adjournment.  Defense requests to address bail in 15CM260.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with the Waukesha Public Library.  Defendant to have no contact with co-actor, businesses and any Waukesha State Bank property.

Defendant Desmond D Cleveland in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is awaiting an offer that encompases both cases.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  State moves to modify conditions of bail to include: No contact with Waukesha Public Library.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court grants motion.  Signature bond to be amended to include: No contact with Waukesha Public Library.  All other conditions to remain as previously set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Jail Inmate Communications Form in regards to the defendant's residency.
Defendant to have no contact with co-actor, businesses and any Waukesha State Bank property.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Desmond D Cleveland in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
